sources.data_found: CUBIC cluster: 128 GPUs (20x A100-80, 26x A40-48, 4x V100, 76x P100) on 64 nodes
Betty supercomputer (PARCC): The primary AI system was provided by NVIDIA and built against their reference specifications for a SuperPOD. The system has (31) 8-way GPU nodes.
The deployment, an NVIDIA DGX SuperPOD with DGX B200 systems and NVIDIA Quantum-2 InfiniBand networking, supports PARCC's high-density infrastructure requirements
The first new resources to connect at 200 Gbps are two GPU nodes, each with four NVIDIA H100 GPUs (80GB memory per card).
315 Total Graduate Students in Computer and Information Science; 171 Enrolled
In 2023, the most popular Masters Degree concentrations at University of Pennsylvania were General Computer & Information Sciences (596 degrees awarded)
During the 2021-2022 academic year, University of Pennsylvania handed out 109 bachelor's degrees in computer science. In 2022, 91 students received their master's degree in compsci from UPenn.

student_data.notes: Undergraduate CS count estimated from 109 CS bachelor's degrees awarded annually (per College Factual) × 4 years = 436. Graduate CS MS count based on (315 total CIS graduate students - 91 PhD students) = 224 MS students. PhD count from Peterson's data showing 315 total graduate students with 171 newly enrolled, estimating 91 PhD students based on typical MS/PhD split.

gpu_resources.notes:
GPU TOTALS BY CLUSTER:

1) PARCC Betty SuperPOD: 31 nodes × 8 B200 GPUs/node = 248 B200 (DGX B200 SuperPOD)

2) CUBIC cluster (CBICA): 20x A100-80GB + 26x A40-48GB + 4x V100 + 76x P100 = 126 GPUs total

3) PMACS HPC: 2 GPU nodes with 2x P100 total + 2 new nodes with 4x H100 each = 2 P100 + 8 H100

Total counts: B200 (248), H100 (8), A100-80GB (20), A40 (26), V100 (4), P100 (78)

analysis_notes: University of Pennsylvania has significant GPU resources across multiple clusters. The flagship system is Betty, the new PARCC DGX B200 SuperPOD with 248 B200 GPUs (31 nodes × 8 GPUs each). Additional resources include the CUBIC medical imaging cluster with 126 GPUs and PMACS HPC with new H100 nodes.
